rawConfiguration.text:
**THE DETAILS IN THIS DASHBOARD ARE ESTIMATES, THE [DATA MANAGEMENT HUB](https://one.newrelic.com/launcher/data-management-nerdlets.data-management-launcher) SHOULD BE USED TO VIEW OFFICIAL INGESTION RATES**

This page analyzes the `Infrastructure Integrations` and `Infrastructure Processes` categories of ingest using the known samples created by the New Relic Kubernetes integration as well as the `Metrics` and `Pixie` data generated by enabling the Prometheus and Pixie integrations, respectively.

*If you find missing data, please [open an issue](https://github.com/newrelic/newrelic-quickstarts/issues/new/choose) on our GitHub!*

nrqlQueries.query: SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS '1 DAY (GB)', rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 1 MONTH) AS '1 MONTH (GB)' FROM NrConsumption WHERE productLine='DataPlatform' AND usageMetric LIKE '%InfraIntegration%' LIMIT MAX SINCE 24 HOURS AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO

FROM
K8sApiServerSample,
K8sClusterSample,
K8sContainerSample,
K8sControllerManagerSample,
K8sDaemonsetSample,
K8sDeploymentSample,
K8sEndpointSample,
K8sNamespaceSample,
K8sNodeSample,
K8sPodSample,
K8sReplicasetSample,
K8sSchedulerSample,
K8sServiceSample,
K8sStatefulsetSample,
K8sVolumeSample,
ProcessSample,
NetworkSample,
StorageSample,
SystemSample
SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'ONE DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'ONE MONTH (GB)'
WHERE clusterName IS NOT NULL
SINCE 1 DAY AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS '1 DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS '1 MONTH (GB)'
WHERE instrumentation.name IN ('nri-prometheus','remote-write')
FACET instrumentation.name 
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM
Metric,
Span
SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'ONE DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'ONE MONTH (GB)'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'pixie'
SINCE 1 DAY AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM 
K8sApiServerSample, K8sClusterSample, K8sContainerSample, K8sControllerManagerSample, K8sDaemonsetSample, K8sDeploymentSample, K8sEndpointSample, K8sNamespaceSample, K8sNodeSample, K8sPodSample, K8sReplicasetSample, K8sSchedulerSample, K8sServiceSample, K8sStatefulsetSample, K8sVolumeSample, ProcessSample, NetworkSample, StorageSample, SystemSample, Metric, Span
SELECT
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() IN ('K8sApiServerSample', 'K8sClusterSample', 'K8sContainerSample', 'K8sControllerManagerSample', 'K8sDaemonsetSample', 'K8sDeploymentSample', 'K8sEndpointSample', 'K8sNamespaceSample', 'K8sNodeSample', 'K8sPodSample', 'K8sReplicasetSample', 'K8sSchedulerSample', 'K8sServiceSample', 'K8sStatefulsetSample', 'K8sVolumeSample', 'ProcessSample', 'NetworkSample', 'StorageSample', 'SystemSample') AND clusterName IS NOT NULL) AS 'Kubernetes',
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() = 'Metric' AND instrumentation.name IN ('nri-prometheus', 'remote-write')) AS 'Prometheus',
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() IN ('Metric', 'Span') AND instrumentation.provider = 'pixie') AS 'Pixie'
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
TIMESERIES

rawConfiguration.text:
![New Relic](https://github.com/cncf/artwork/raw/master/projects/kubernetes/stacked/color/kubernetes-stacked-color.png)

**THE DETAILS IN THIS DASHBOARD ARE ESTIMATES, THE [DATA MANAGEMENT HUB](https://one.newrelic.com/launcher/data-management-nerdlets.data-management-launcher) SHOULD BE USED TO VIEW OFFICIAL INGESTION RATES**

*If you find a problem with this dashboard, please [open an issue](https://github.com/newrelic/newrelic-quickstarts/issues/new/choose) on our GitHub!*

This page analyzes both the `Infrastructure Integrations` and `Infrastructure Processes` categories of ingest using the known samples created by the New Relic Kubernetes integration. 

All recommendations on this page are relative to the needs of the [Kubernetes Cluster Explorer](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/integrations/kubernetes-integration/understand-use-data/kubernetes-cluster-explorer).

Granular details about the various event types can be found on the *"Usage Breakdown -** pages.

The event types created by these integrations:
* [Kubernetes Data Types](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/integrations/kubernetes-integration/understand-use-data/find-use-your-kubernetes-data#event-types)
* [Kubernetes Events Integration](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/integrations/kubernetes-integration/kubernetes-events/install-kubernetes-events-integration#use-data)
* [Infrastructure Data Types](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/infrastructure/manage-your-data/data-instrumentation/default-infrastructure-events#infrastructure-events)

nrqlQueries.query: SELECT sum(GigabytesIngested) AS '1 DAY (GB)', rate(sum(GigabytesIngested), 1 MONTH) AS '1 MONTH (GB)' FROM NrConsumption WHERE productLine='DataPlatform' AND usageMetric LIKE '%InfraIntegration%' LIMIT MAX SINCE 24 HOURS AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO

FROM
K8sApiServerSample,
K8sClusterSample,
K8sContainerSample,
K8sControllerManagerSample,
K8sDaemonsetSample,
K8sDeploymentSample,
K8sEndpointSample,
K8sNamespaceSample,
K8sNodeSample,
K8sPodSample,
K8sReplicasetSample,
K8sSchedulerSample,
K8sServiceSample,
K8sStatefulsetSample,
K8sVolumeSample,
ProcessSample,
NetworkSample,
StorageSample,
SystemSample
SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'ONE DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'ONE MONTH (GB)'
WHERE clusterName IS NOT NULL
SINCE 1 DAY AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO
LIMIT MAX

rawConfiguration.text:
## Required Metrics
This widget breaks out the data types that are required for the Kubernetes Cluster Explorer to maintain functionality. These include: 
```
# Kubernetes Data Types
    K8sClusterSample,
    K8sContainerSample,
    K8sNodeSample,
    K8sPodSample,
    K8sVolumeSample,
    K8sApiServerSample,**
    K8sControllerManagerSample,**
    K8sEtcdSample,**
    K8sSchedulerSample**
# Kubernetes Events Integration
    InfrastructureEvent
# Infrastructure Data Types
    NetworkSample,
    StorageSample,
    SystemSample
```
***Control Plane metrics are not collected on hosted Kubernetes clusters by default*

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM
K8sClusterSample,
K8sContainerSample,
K8sNodeSample,
K8sPodSample,
K8sVolumeSample,
InfrastructureEvent,
NetworkSample,
StorageSample,
SystemSample,
K8sApiServerSample,
K8sControllerManagerSample,
K8sEtcdSample,
K8sSchedulerSample
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'ONE DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'ONE MONTH (GB)'
WHERE clusterName IS NOT NULL
SINCE 1 DAY AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM
K8sClusterSample,
K8sContainerSample,
K8sNodeSample,
K8sPodSample,
K8sVolumeSample,
InfrastructureEvent,
NetworkSample,
StorageSample,
SystemSample,
K8sApiServerSample,
K8sControllerManagerSample,
K8sEtcdSample,
K8sSchedulerSample
SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS '1 DAY (GB)'
WHERE clusterName IS NOT NULL
FACET eventType()
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
TIMESERIES
LIMIT MAX

rawConfiguration.text:
## Low Data Mode - Potential Savings
This widget shows the potential savings enabling `lowDataMode` during installation of the `nri-bundle` Helm chart. This change includes setting the `global.lowDataMode=true` value. Documentation and examples can be found on our [public docs site](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/kubernetes-pixie/kubernetes-integration/installation/install-kubernetes-integration-using-helm/#reducedataingest).

This setting affects the following 3 areas:

 * **Prometheus OpenMetrics Integration**: adds exclusion filters to omit data already collected by the Kubernetes integration
 * **New Relic Logging**: drops all `label` and `annotation` decoration from logs. *Note: As the attribute sizes are variable in nature, we do not analyze potential savings for logs on this dashboard.*
 * **New Relic Pixie Integration**: increases sampling size for Spans and reduces overall collection interval from 10s to 15s. *Estimated 50% reduction per PXL script execution*

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS 'SAVED PER DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS 'SAVED PER MONTH (GB)'
WHERE instrumentation.name = 'nri-prometheus'
AND metricName RLIKE r'^kube_.*|^container_.*|^machine_.*|^cadvisor.*'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric, Span
SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 * .5 AS 'SAVED PER DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8 * .5, 1 MONTH) AS 'SAVED PER MONTH (GB)'
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'pixie'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

rawConfiguration.text:
## Scrape Interval Reduction - Potential Savings
This widget shows the potential savings (estimated at 25% reduction per data type) you can achieve by changing the default scrape interval of `newrelic-infrastructure` from 15s to 20s.

This change includes adding a `ConfigMap` to provide the custom definition, and then adding associated `volumes` and `volumeMounts` entries to the `Daemonset`. Sample manifest can be found on the **Advanced Configuration Options** tab.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM
K8sClusterSample,
K8sContainerSample,
K8sNodeSample,
K8sPodSample,
K8sVolumeSample,
NetworkSample,
StorageSample,
SystemSample,
ProcessSample,
K8sApiServerSample,
K8sControllerManagerSample,
K8sEtcdSample,
K8sSchedulerSample,
K8sDaemonsetSample,
K8sDeploymentSample,
K8sEndpointSample,
K8sNamespaceSample,
K8sReplicasetSample,
K8sServiceSample,
K8sStatefulsetSample
SELECT (bytecountestimate()/10e8)*.25 AS 'SAVED PER DAY (GB)',
rate((bytecountestimate()/10e8)*.25, 1 MONTH) AS 'SAVED PER MONTH (GB)'
WHERE clusterName IS NOT NULL
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

rawConfiguration.text:
## Optional Metrics - Potential Savings
This widget breaks out the data types that are NOT required and can be removed without impacting the Kubernetes Cluster Explorer. These include:
```
# Kubernetes Data Types
    K8sDaemonsetSample,
    K8sDeploymentSample,
    K8sEndpointSample,
    K8sNamespaceSample,
    K8sReplicasetSample,
    K8sServiceSample,
    K8sStatefulsetSample

# Infrastructure Data Types
    ProcessSample
```

Guidance on disabling KSM collectors and `ProcessSample` events are available for both Helm and Manifest deployments on the **Advanced Configuration Options** tab.

rawConfiguration.text:
![New Relic](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Prometheus_software_logo.svg/230px-Prometheus_software_logo.svg.png)

This page analyzes data coming from both the [Prometheus OpenMetrics Integration (POMI)](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/integrations/prometheus-integrations/get-started/send-prometheus-metric-data-new-relic/#OpenMetrics) and New Relic's [Remote Write Integration](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/integrations/prometheus-integrations/get-started/send-prometheus-metric-data-new-relic/#remote-write). In the [Data Management Hub](https://one.newrelic.com/launcher/data-management-nerdlets.data-management-launcher), these are reflected in the `Metrics` category. Data ingest for these integrations is most easily controlled in the [Prometheus configuration](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/latest/configuration/configuration/) by ensuring you only collect metrics you need using controls like scrape labels and relabel functions to filter data before shipping.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS '1 DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS '1 MONTH (GB)'
WHERE instrumentation.name IN ('nri-prometheus','remote-write')
FACET instrumentation.name 
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8
WHERE instrumentation.name IN ('nri-prometheus','remote-write')
FACET instrumentation.name 
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
LIMIT MAX
TIMESERIES

FROM Metric
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS '1 DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS '1 MONTH (GB)'
WHERE instrumentation.name = 'nri-prometheus'
FACET clusterName, namespaceName, deploymentName, metricName
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8
WHERE instrumentation.name = 'nri-prometheus'
FACET clusterName
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
LIMIT 10
TIMESERIES

FROM Metric
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS '1 DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS '1 MONTH (GB)'
WHERE instrumentation.name = 'remote-write'
FACET prometheus_server, metricName
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO
LIMIT MAX

widgets.title: Remote Write Timeline - Top 10 Prometheus Servers

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric
SELECT bytecountestimate()/10e8
WHERE instrumentation.name = 'remote-write'
FACET prometheus_server
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
LIMIT 10
TIMESERIES

rawConfiguration.text:
![Pixie](https://github.com/cncf/artwork/raw/master/projects/pixie/stacked/color/pixie-stacked-color.png)

This page analyzes data coming from the [Pixie integration](). In the [Data Management Hub](https://one.newrelic.com/launcher/data-management-nerdlets.data-management-launcher), this data is reflected in the `Pixie` category for `Metric` and `Span` data, and the `Logging` category for the container logs. 

Data ingest for this integration is most easily controlled in the [lowDataMode](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/kubernetes-pixie/kubernetes-integration/installation/install-kubernetes-integration-using-helm/#new-relic-pixie-integration) Helm chart setting along with the ['excludeNamespacesRegex' and 'excludePodsRegex'](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/kubernetes-pixie/auto-telemetry-pixie/manage-pixie-data/#reduce-ingest-helm) settings available in the Pixie integration settings.

nrqlQueries.query:
FROM Metric, Span, Log
SELECT
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() = 'Metric' AND instrumentation.provider = 'pixie') AS 'Metrics - 1 DAY(GB)',
filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'Metric' AND instrumentation.provider = 'pixie') AS 'Metrics - 1 MONTH(GB)',
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() = 'Span' AND instrumentation.provider = 'pixie') AS 'Spans - 1 DAY(GB)',
filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'Span' AND instrumentation.provider = 'pixie') AS 'Spans - 1 MONTH(GB)',
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() = 'Log' AND pod_name RLIKE r'vizier.*|kelvin.*|query_broker.*|.*nats.*') AS 'Logs - 1 DAY(GB)',
filter(rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH), WHERE eventType() = 'Log' AND pod_name RLIKE r'vizier.*|kelvin.*|query_broker.*|.*nats.*') AS 'Logs - 1 MONTH(GB)'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric, Span, Log
SELECT
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() = 'Metric' AND instrumentation.provider = 'pixie') AS 'Metrics',
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() = 'Span' AND instrumentation.provider = 'pixie') AS 'Spans',
filter(bytecountestimate()/10e8, WHERE eventType() = 'Log' AND pod_name RLIKE r'vizier.*|kelvin.*|query_broker.*|.*nats.*') AS 'Logs'
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
TIMESERIES

FROM Metric, Span, Log
SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8 AS '1 DAY (GB)',
rate(bytecountestimate()/10e8, 1 MONTH) AS '1 MONTH (GB)'
FACET k8s.cluster.name OR cluster_name
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'pixie'
OR pod_name RLIKE r'vizier.*|kelvin.*|query_broker.*|.*nats.*'
SINCE 24 HOURS AGO COMPARE WITH 1 WEEK AGO
LIMIT MAX

FROM Metric, Span, Log
SELECT
bytecountestimate()/10e8
FACET k8s.cluster.name OR cluster_name
WHERE instrumentation.provider = 'pixie'
OR pod_name RLIKE r'vizier.*|kelvin.*|query_broker.*|.*nats.*'
SINCE 7 DAYS AGO
TIMESERIES

rawConfiguration.text:
# Scrape Interval Manifest

This manifest adds the ConfigMap, Volume, and VolumeMount required to provide a custom definition file and update the default scrape interval for `nri-kubernetes` daemon from 15s to 20s. You will need to update the `<YOUR_CLUSTER_NAME>` and `<YOUR_LICENSE_KEY>` placeholders in the environment variables section of the Daemonset.

*Note that customization of the scrape interval is not supported on Helm or Kubernetes on Windows at this time.*

---

```yaml
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: ServiceAccount
metadata:
  name: newrelic
  namespace: default
automountServiceAccountToken: true
---
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRole
metadata:
  name: newrelic
rules:
- apiGroups: [""]
  resources:
    - "nodes"
    - "nodes/metrics"
    - "nodes/stats"
    - "nodes/proxy"
    - "pods"
    - "secrets"
    - "services"
  verbs: ["get", "list"]
- nonResourceURLs: ["/metrics"]
  verbs: ["get"]
---
apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1
kind: ClusterRoleBinding
metadata:
  name: newrelic
roleRef:
  apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io
  kind: ClusterRole
  name: newrelic
subjects:
- kind: ServiceAccount
  name: newrelic
  namespace: default
---
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: DaemonSet
metadata:
  name: newrelic-infra
  namespace: default
  labels:
    app: newrelic-infra
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      name: newrelic-infra
  updateStrategy:
      type: RollingUpdate
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        name: newrelic-infra
    spec:
      serviceAccountName: newrelic
      hostNetwork: true # This option is a requirement for the Infrastructure Agent to report the proper hostname in New Relic.
      dnsPolicy: ClusterFirstWithHostNet
      containers:
        - name: newrelic-infra
          image: newrelic/infrastructure-k8s:2.0.1
          securityContext:
            privileged: true
          resources:
            limits:
              memory: 300M
            requests:
              cpu: 100m
              memory: 150M
          volumeMounts:
            - mountPath: /host
              name: host-volume
              readOnly: true
            - mountPath: /var/run/docker.sock
              name: host-docker-socket
            - mountPath: /var/db/newrelic-infra/integrations.d/
              name: nri-default-integration-cfg-volume
            - mountPath: /etc/newrelic-infra/integrations.d/
              name: nri-integration-cfg-volume
            # Volume Mount added for custom defintion file used to set scrape interval
            - mountPath: /var/db/newrelic-infra/newrelic-integrations/nri-kubernetes-definition.yml
              name: nri-kubernetes-definition-cfg-volume
              subPath: nri-kubernetes-definition.yml
          env:
            - name: "CLUSTER_NAME"
              value: "<YOUR_CLUSTER_NAME>"
            - name: "NRIA_LICENSE_KEY"
              value: "<YOUR_LICENSE_KEY>"
            - name: "NRIA_VERBOSE"
              value: "0"
           # - name: "KUBE_STATE_METRICS_POD_LABEL" # Enables discovery of the KSM pod via a label. The value of the label needs to be "true".
           #   value: "<YOUR_LABEL>" # Remember to replace this placeholder with the label name of your choice.
           # - name: "KUBE_STATE_METRICS_PORT" # If the KUBE_STATE_METRICS_POD_LABEL is present, it changes the port queried in the pod.
           #   value: "8080"
           # - name: "KUBE_STATE_METRICS_SCHEME" # If the KUBE_STATE_METRICS_POD_LABEL is present, it changes the scheme used to send to request to the pod.
           #   value: "http"
           # - name: "CADVISOR_PORT" # Enable direct connection to cAdvisor by specifying the port. Needed for Kubernetes versions prior to 1.7.6.
           #   value: "4194"
           # - name: "KUBE_STATE_METRICS_URL" # If this value is specified then discovery process for kube-state-metrics endpoint won't be triggered.
           #   value: "http://172.17.0.3:8080" # This is example value. Only HTTP request is accepted.
           # - name: "ETCD_TLS_SECRET_NAME" # Name of the secret containing the cacert, cert and key used for setting the mTLS config for retrieving metrics from ETCD.
           #   value: "newrelic-infra-etcd-tls-secret"
           # - name: "ETCD_TLS_SECRET_NAMESPACE" # Namespace where the the secret specified in ETCD_TLS_SECRET_NAME was created.
           #   value: "default"
           # Note: Usage of API_SERVER_SECURE_PORT has been deprecated in favor of API_SERVER_ENDPOINT_URL.
           # - name: API_SERVER_SECURE_PORT
           #   value: "6443"
           # - name: "SCHEDULER_ENDPOINT_URL"
           #   value: "https://localhost:10259"
           # - name: "ETCD_ENDPOINT_URL"
           #   value: "https://localhost:9979"
           # - name: "CONTROLLER_MANAGER_ENDPOINT_URL"
           #   value: "https://localhost:10257"
           # - name: "API_SERVER_ENDPOINT_URL"
           #   value: "https://localhost:6443"
            - name: "NRIA_DISPLAY_NAME"
              valueFrom:
                fieldRef:
                  apiVersion: "v1"
                  fieldPath: "spec.nodeName"
            - name: "NRK8S_NODE_NAME"
              valueFrom:
                fieldRef:
                  apiVersion: "v1"
                  fieldPath: "spec.nodeName"
            - name: "NRIA_CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTES"
              value: '{"clusterName":"$(CLUSTER_NAME)"}'
            - name: "NRIA_PASSTHROUGH_ENVIRONMENT"
              value: "KUBERNETES_SERVICE_HOST,KUBERNETES_SERVICE_PORT,CLUSTER_NAME,CADVISOR_PORT,NRK8S_NODE_NAME,KUBE_STATE_METRICS_URL,KUBE_STATE_METRICS_POD_LABEL,ETCD_TLS_SECRET_NAME,ETCD_TLS_SECRET_NAMESPACE,API_SERVER_SECURE_PORT,KUBE_STATE_METRICS_SCHEME,KUBE_STATE_METRICS_PORT,SCHEDULER_ENDPOINT_URL,ETCD_ENDPOINT_URL,CONTROLLER_MANAGER_ENDPOINT_URL,API_SERVER_ENDPOINT_URL,DISABLE_KUBE_STATE_METRICS,NETWORK_ROUTE_FILE"
      volumes:
        - name: host-volume
          hostPath:
            path: /
        - name: host-docker-socket
          hostPath:
            path: /var/run/docker.sock
        - name: nri-default-integration-cfg-volume
          configMap:
            name: nri-default-integration-cfg
        - name: nri-integration-cfg-volume
          configMap:
            name: nri-integration-cfg
        # Volume added for custom defintion file used to set scrape interval
        - name: nri-kubernetes-definition-cfg-volume
          configMap:
            name: nri-kubernetes-definition-cfg

      tolerations:
        - operator: "Exists"
          effect: "NoSchedule"
        - operator: "Exists"
          effect: "NoExecute"
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: nri-default-integration-cfg # integrations config provided by default
  namespace: default
data:
  nri-kubernetes-config.yml: |
    integration_name: com.newrelic.kubernetes
    instances:
      - name: nri-kubernetes
        command: metrics
---
# Custom Definition File to Set New Scrape Interval
apiVersion: v1
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: nri-kubernetes-definition-cfg
  namespace: default
data:
  nri-kubernetes-definition.yml: |
    name: com.newrelic.kubernetes
    description: "This NR Infrastructure definition uses a non-default 20s interval"
    protocol_version: 2
    os: linux
    commands:
      metrics:
        command:
          - ./bin/nri-kubernetes
          - --metrics
        interval: 20
```

# Helm Chart: Disabling Optional KSM metrics and ProcessSample
Note that this requires that you have installed KSM via Helm. This is embedded in nri-bundle, but not in the stand-alone newrelic-infrastructure chart. 

## Helm command to disable "optional" collectors for New Relic Kubernetes integration
[Available Collectors for KSM Helm chart](https://github.com/kubernetes/kube-state-metrics/blob/fb48293a4012c16392f370e9ea8c77a1b66d24c3/charts/kube-state-metrics/values.yaml#L112-L142)

---

```shell
helm <install|update> newrelic-bundle newrelic/nri-bundle \
 ...
 --set kube-state-metrics.collectors.daemonsets=false \
 --set kube-state-metrics.collectors.deployments=false \
 --set kube-state-metrics.collectors.endpoints=false \
 --set kube-state-metrics.collectors.namespaces=false \
 --set kube-state-metrics.collectors.replicasets=false \
 --set kube-state-metrics.collectors.services=false \
 --set kube-state-metrics.collectors.statefulsets=false
```

---
## Helm command to disable "ProcessSample" events for New Relic Kubernetes integration
[Disabling Process collection for New Relic](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/infrastructure/install-infrastructure-agent/configuration/infrastructure-agent-configuration-settings#enable-process-metrics)

```shell
helm <install|update> newrelic-bundle newrelic/nri-bundle \
 ...
 --set enableProcessMetrics=false
```

# Manifest: Disabling Optional KSM metrics and ProcessSample
---
## YAML Key Path: spec.template.spec.name.args
Comment out these items to update the kube-state-metrics Deployment config

```yaml
[spec]
  [template]
    [spec]
      [containers]
        [name=kube-state-metrics]
        [args]
         #- --collectors=daemonsets
         #- --collectors=deployments
         #- --collectors=endpoints
         #- --collectors=namespaces
         #- --collectors=replicasets
         #- --collectors=services
         #- --collectors=statefulsets
```
---
## YAML Key Path: rules.apiGroups
Comment out these items to update the kube-state-metrics ClusterRole config

```yaml
[rules]
# - apiGroups: ["extensions", "apps"]
#   resources:
#   - daemonsets
#   verbs: ["list", "watch"]

# - apiGroups: ["extensions", "apps"]
#   resources:
#   - deployments
#   verbs: ["list", "watch"]

# - apiGroups: [""]
#   resources:
#   - endpoints
#   verbs: ["list", "watch"]

# - apiGroups: [""]
#   resources:
#   - namespaces
#   verbs: ["list", "watch"]

# - apiGroups: ["extensions", "apps"]
#   resources:
#   - replicasets
#   verbs: ["list", "watch"]

# - apiGroups: [""]
#   resources:
#   - services
#   verbs: ["list", "watch"]

# - apiGroups: ["apps"]
#   resources:
#   - statefulsets
#   verbs: ["list", "watch"]
```
---
## YAML Key Path: spec.template.spec.containers.name.env
Add [environment variable](https://docs.newrelic.com/docs/infrastructure/install-infrastructure-agent/configuration/infrastructure-agent-configuration-settings#enable-process-metrics) to disable ProcessSample collection in the newrelic-infrastructure Daemonset

```yaml
[spec]
  [template]
    [spec]
      [containers]
        [name=newrelic-infrastructure]
        [env]
           - name: "NRIA_ENABLE_PROCESS_METRICS"
             value: false
```
